results.title: Forty thousand horsemen
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Famous Feature Films
results.brief_description: Forty thousand horsemen is set during World War 1 and deals with the exploits of the Australian Light Horse in Palestine. Chauvel’s uncle, who led the actual charge at Beersheba, was the inspiration for this acclaimed historical recreation. The film is unapologetically intensly nationalistic, viewed through the eyes of three Anzacs, Red (Grant Taylor), Larry (Pat Twohill) and Jim (Chips Rafferty). This internationally successful film established Chips Rafferty’s laconic bushman stereotype for which he became renown and established Chauvel as a world class director.

results.title: Forty million shoes: a report on Brazil
results.creator_credit: Douglas Leiterman, Cliff Solway and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes the gulf between the rich and poor of Brazil, and the difficulty of escaping the peasants’ trap of working for the land-owner. Also discusses the inevitability of change in Brazil by “democratic” or “totalitarian” means and the possibility of a solution being provided by either “free enterprise” and foreign capital, or by the Brazilian “communist” land leagues.

results.title: Forty guns = 40 guns
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Globe Enterprises and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A classic example of the Western genre, written, directed and produced by maverick Samuel Fuller. Shot in black and white and “cinemascope” this lush film is filled with all you would expect from a Western: guns, fancy horse riding, showdowns and a bit of romance. The tough town femme-fatale Jessica Drummond (Barbara Stanwyck) has a posse of forty hired guns that make her the de facto leader of the County. She falls in love with a Marshall (Barry Sullivan) who arrives to restore law and order with tensions building up to a showdown.

results.title: Fortress Australia: the secret bid for the Atomic Bomb [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Peter Butt, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: How close Australia came during the 1950s and ‘60s to creating our own weapons of mass destruction is revealed in this edifying documentary. During the secrecy of the Cold War era, Australia’s Atomic Energy Commission, run by Sir Phillip Baxter, was set up to push an atomic weaponry solution to fortify Australian defences. Now uncovered “Top Secret” documents from the era demonstrate the machinations of government and our tentative relations with the Allies when it came to the nuclear question. Research reactors, guided missile test sites and “The Bomb” at Woomera are all discussed, as is “Operation Blowdown”, a secret event where 50 Tons of TNT was exploded in Far North Queensland to illustrate the possible effect of a nuclear strike in jungle terrain and its implications for foot soldiers. Narrated by Robyn Williams. Part of Film Australia’s National Interest Program series, produced with assistance from the Australian Broadcasting Corporation.

results.title: Fortress
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Raymond Menmuir and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Gabrielle Lord. A teacher and her class of nine students are kidnapped by four masked men and held for ransom. The victims plot to escape by outwitting their captors.

results.title: Fortnite
results.brief_description:
Fortnite is the living, action building game from the developer formerly known as Epic MegaGames. You and your friends will lead a group of Heroes to reclaim and rebuild a homeland that has been left empty by mysterious darkness only known as “the Storm”.

Band together online to build extravagant forts, find or build insane weapons and traps and protect your towns from the strange monsters that emerge during the Storm. In an action experience from the only company smart enough to attach chainsaws to guns, get out there to push back the Storm and save the world. And don’t forget to loot all the things.

constellations_other.name: MoCaps and rotos
constellations_other.description: Though VFX continues to push boundaries and brings fantastical worlds and creatures to life, there's still a place for classic animation techniques.

results.title: Fort Good Hope
results.creator_credit: Ron Orieux, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shot during the Berger Inquiry into the Mackenzie Valley pipeline, this film presents the Native people’s point of view. The majority feel it would destroy their ancient hunting grounds and upset the balance of nature, and that Canada’s title to the land is far from settled. This film raises important questions about northern development in general.

results.title: Forrest Gump [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Steve Starkey, Steve Tisch, Wendy Finerman, Steven Tisch and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Forrest Gump touched the hearts and minds of filmgoers and scooped the 1994 Academy Awards. Forrest Gump, sensitively portrayed by Tom Hanks, has a low IQ but through the fierce determination of his mother (Sally Field), takes his place upon the stage of history as the events of three decades unfold around him. Forrest’s naive perception of the world contradicts the harsh realities of the Vietnam War and the disillusionment of the “flower power” generation, while his “rags to riches” story is pure fairytale. Nevertheless, Forrest’s courage, his strong sense of values and his simple innocence allow him to weather adversity. The special effects editing which allows Forrest to make his mark on history is noteworthy together with strong cast performances. Cast also includes Gary Sinise and Robin Wright.

results.title: Forms of music: instrumental
results.brief_description: Most of the major forms of instrumental music are presented, using animation. Music of Bach, haydn, Mozart and Beethoven illustrate the historical development of the sonata form, the clasical sonata, the concerto, the symphony, and the tone poem, as well as earlier forms of music.

results.title: Formosa today
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bradley, Associated Television and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Progress in Formosa (Taiwan) since the arrival of Chiang Kai-Shek, and American post war aid. Rapid development in industry and agriculture, roads and railways, education. With greater prosperity, America’s aid is decreasing, and foreign investment increasing. Poses the questions, whether Chiang Kai-Shek has been successful in presenting Formosa as an alternative to Communism.
